metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4233 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the MySQL Server component in Oracle MySQL 5.6.17 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affect availability via vectors related to SRREP.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
